Class Level

java.lang.Object

  • Field Details

    • MIN_SIZE

      private static final int MIN_SIZE
      Minimum size of the board in one direction, the board will be sizexsize
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • UNLIMITED_LIVES

      private static final int UNLIMITED_LIVES
      Number representing unlimited number of lives for a player.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • size

      private final int size
      Number of rows and columns in the game board. A board is a square of size x size.

    • difficulty

      private LevelDifficulty difficulty
      Difficulty of the level

    • board

      private Cell[][] board
      2D array representing each cell in the game board.

    • numMoves

      private int numMoves
      The number of moves performed by the player (excluding invalid moves).

      private int numLives
      The number of lives the player has.

    • numGemsGot

      private int numGemsGot
      The number of gems the player has got.

    • numGemsInit

      private final int numGemsInit
      The number of gems initially on the game board when a Level instance was created.

    • undoStack

      private final UndoStack undoStack
      Data structure that allows us to undo moves and manage its information.

      Constructor
      Parameters:
      fileName - Name of the file that contains level's data.
      Throws:
      LevelException - When there is any error while parsing the file.

    • hasUnlimitedLives

      private boolean hasUnlimitedLives()
      It checks whether the player has unlimited lives
      Returns:
      {code true} if the player has unlimited lives, otherwise false.

    • getNumLives

      public int getNumLives()
      Returns:
      The number of lives a player has. If the player has an unlimited number of lives, returns Integer.MAX_VALUE.

    • setNumLives

      private void setNumLives(int numLives)
      Setter of the attribute numLives.
      Parameters:
      numLives - New value for the attribute numLives.

    • increaseNumLives

      public void increaseNumLives(int num) throws LevelException
      Increases the player's number of lives by num. If the player has unlimited number of lives or it is zero, then it does not increase the number of lives.
      Parameters:
      num - Number to increase numLives
      Throws:
      LevelException - When num is a negative value.

    • decreaseNumLives

      public void decreaseNumLives()
      Decreases the player's number of lives by 1. If the player has unlimited number of lives or it is zero, it does not decrease the number of lives. Integer.MAX_VALUE.

    • increaseNumGemsGot

      public void increaseNumGemsGot(int numGemsGot) throws LevelException
      Increases num the number of gems got by the player.
      Parameters:
      numGemsGot - Number to increase numGemsGot
      Throws:
      LevelException - When numGemsGot is a negative value

    • decreaseNumGemsGot

      public void decreaseNumGemsGot()
      Decreases the number of gems got it, but it checks that numGemsGot is always zero or greater than zero.

    • getNumGemsGot

      public int getNumGemsGot()
      Getter of the attribute numGemsGot.
      Returns:
      The value of the attribute numGemsGot.

    • getNumMoves

      public int getNumMoves()
      Getter of the attribute numMoves.
      Returns:
      The current number of moves taken by the player.

    • increaseNumMoves

      public void increaseNumMoves()
      Increments by 1 the number of moves taken by the player.

    • getNumGemsInit

      public int getNumGemsInit()
      Getter of the attribute numGemsInit
      Returns:
      The number of gems that the level had initially.

    • hasWon

      public boolean hasWon()
      Checks whether the game has been won.

      The game is won when there are no gems left in the game board.

      Returns:
      Whether the player has won the game.

    • hasLost

      public boolean hasLost()
      Checks whether the game has been lost.

      The game is lost when the player has no lives remaining. For games which the player has unlimited lives, this condition should never trigger.

      Returns:
      Whether the player has lost the game.

    • getBoard

      private Cell[][] getBoard()
      Getter of the attribute board.
      Returns:
      The instance of the managed board.

    • getCell

      public Cell getCell(int row, int column) throws LevelException
      Returns the Cell object that is in the position (row, column).
      Parameters:
      row - Row of the cell which we want to retrieve.
      column - Column of the cell which we want to retrieve.
      Returns:
      Cell object that is in the position (row, column).
      Throws:
      LevelException - When either row or column is incorrect.

    • getCell

      public Cell getCell(Position position) throws LevelException
      Returns the Cell object that is in position.
      Parameters:
      position - Position in which the cell we want to retrieve is.
      Returns:
      Cell object that is in position.
      Throws:
      LevelException - When either row or column is incorrect.

    • setCell

      public void setCell(Position position, Element element) throws LevelException
      Set the element in the position of the board.
      Parameters:
      position - Position in which the cell we want to set is.
      element - Element which we want to set.
      Throws:
      LevelException - When either row or column is incorrect.

    • getPlayerPosition

      public Position getPlayerPosition()
      Returns the Position where the player is. A player is represented by Element.PLAYER or Element.PLAYER_STOP.
      Returns:
      Position where the player is.

    • getScore

      public int getScore()

      At any point of the game, the score should be computed using the following formula:

      • The initial score of any game board is size * size.
      • Each gem will be worth 10 points.
      • Each valid move deducts one point.
      • Each undo deducts two points.
      Returns:
      The current score of this game.

    • push

      public StackItem push(StackItem item)
      Push the StackItem in the undoStack.
      Parameters:
      item - New item to push at the top of the undoStack.
      Returns:
      The item that has been pushed.

    • undo

      public boolean undo() throws LevelException
      Restores the last move that has been taken.
      So, if the undo is successful, then the level is a previous state in terms of the position of the elements.
      Returns:
      true if the undo has been done, otherwise false.
      Throws:
      LevelException - When either row or column is incorrect.

    • parse

      private int parse(String fileName) throws LevelException
      Parses/Reads level's data from the given file.
      It also checks which the board's requirements are met.
      Parameters:
      fileName - Name of the file that contains level's data.
      Returns:
      The size of the board in one direction (i.e. row or column). The board is size x size.
      Throws:
      LevelException - When there is any error while parsing the file or some board's requirement is not satisfied. *

    • getFirstNonEmptyLine

      private String getFirstNonEmptyLine(BufferedReader br) throws IOException
      This is a helper method for parse(String fileName) which returns the first non-empty and non-comment line from the reader.
      Parameters:
      br - BufferedReader object to read from.
      Returns:
      First line that is a parsable line, or null there are no lines to read.
      Throws:
      IOException - if the reader fails to read a line.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a String with textual version of the board.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      Textual version of the board.
